revised_title: Stabilities and Kinetics of Gas-Phase Ions CO in Oxygen-Rich Flames
tldr: This study investigates the stabilities and kinetics of gas-phase ions CO in oxygen-rich flames. The authors found that CO2+ ions are the first to form in these flames, followed by O2+ ions. They also determined the rate constants for the forward and reverse steps of the reactions involving these ions. The study provides a better understanding of the chemical processes occurring in oxygen-rich flames and their applications, such as in internal combustion engines.
scientific_discipline: Chemistry > Chemical kinetics and reaction dynamics
